summary: The Know Your Rates Act (H.R. 1412) amends the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 to require electric and gas utilities to provide consumers with more detailed information about their energy consumption and billing. This includes the difference in billing amounts from previous periods, average monthly consumption, and notifications when consumption exceeds previous levels. It also includes an option for consumers to set alerts based on dollar amounts. Finally, it defines covered utilities as those receiving federal funding.
